info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 26 at 6:58PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Spartanburg and west central Cherokee Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 658 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 5 miles north of Spartanburg, or near USC Upstate. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Spartanburg, Boiling Springs SC, Cowpens, Mayo, USC Upstate and Thicketty. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
